texts: xx/xx/xx \nI woke up.The person who purchased me left me an order. "I am busy, so look after my kid for me."
xx/xx/xx I woke up.The person who purchased me left me an order. "I am busy, so look after my kid for me."
xx/xx/xx I woke up.The person who purchased me left me an order. "I am busy, so look after my kid for me."
My master is a nine year-old female. \nThe first thing she said to me was "Let's be friends!" She appears to be a friendly person. I replied, \n"Gladly."
My master is a nine year-old female. The first thing she said to me was "Let's be friends!" She appears to be a friendly person. I replied, "Gladly."
My master is a nine year-old female. The first thing she said to me was "Let's be friends!" She appears to be a friendly person. I replied, "Gladly."
xx/xx/xx \nMaster gave me a name.She said,  "It's difficult to call for you without a name."
xx/xx/xx Master gave me a name.She said,  "It's difficult to call for you without a name."
xx/xx/xx Master gave me a name.She said,  "It's difficult to call for you without a name."

She thought up some options. 
"Ruri"
 "Natsumi""Toaster""Dave"
 "Iron Girl".
She thought up some options. "Ruri" "Natsumi""Toaster""Dave" "Iron Girl".
She thought up some options. "Ruri" "Natsumi""Toaster""Dave" "Iron Girl".
She could not decide on one. \nI explained to her that "Iron Girl" may be infringing on several copyrights. "Aww, it makes you sound like a superhero, though!", she replied.
She could not decide on one. I explained to her that "Iron Girl" may be infringing on several copyrights. "Aww, it makes you sound like a superhero, though!", she replied.
She could not decide on one. I explained to her that "Iron Girl" may be infringing on several copyrights. "Aww, it makes you sound like a superhero, though!", she replied.

xx/xx/xx \nA bird sat on my shoulder when I was out with my master. I twittered loudly directly adjacent to my aural sensors. It was very annoying. More of them came. \nThey sat on my other shoulder and my head. I judged them a hindrance to my duty, and attempted to remove them. My master laughed.

xx/xx/xx A bird sat on my shoulder when I was out with my master. I twittered loudly directly adjacent to my aural sensors. It was very annoying. More of them came. They sat on my other shoulder and my head. I judged them a hindrance to my duty, and attempted to remove them. My master laughed.

xx/xx/xx A bird sat on my shoulder when I was out with my master. I twittered loudly directly adjacent to my aural sensors. It was very annoying. More of them came. They sat on my other shoulder and my head. I judged them a hindrance to my duty, and attempted to remove them. My master laughed.

"It looks like they really like you. They must think you're one of them." \n"Those are bramblings. Hmm, they're called %i1atori%id in Japan, where they come to spend the winter... 'Atri' would be a nice name! I'll call you that!" She has given me the name "Atri."My analysis indicates that being given a personal name is a sign of being accepted by humans. \nThe bramblings flew away after staying on my shoulder for a moment.

"It looks like they really like you. They must think you're one of them." "Those are bramblings. Hmm, they're called atori in Japan, where they come to spend the winter... 'Atri' would be a nice name! I'll call you that!" She has given me the name "Atri."My analysis indicates that being given a personal name is a sign of being accepted by humans. The bramblings flew away after staying on my shoulder for a moment.

xx/xx/xx \nThe person who purchased me, my master's mother, is too busy with her work to perform household chores. I will do them in her stead.
xx/xx/xx The person who purchased me, my master's mother, is too busy with her work to perform household chores. I will do them in her stead.
xx/xx/xx The person who purchased me, my master's mother, is too busy with her work to perform household chores. I will do them in her stead.
I made a mistake. \nI made a mistake. I made a mistake.
I made a mistake. I made a mistake. I made a mistake.
I made a mistake. I made a mistake. I made a mistake.
My failures upset my master. \nHowever, her mood improved when I gave her snacks. "Even if you make a mistake, I'll forgive you. We're friends, after all." She forgave me for my mistakes.
My failures upset my master. However, her mood improved when I gave her snacks. "Even if you make a mistake, I'll forgive you. We're friends, after all." She forgave me for my mistakes.
My failures upset my master. However, her mood improved when I gave her snacks. "Even if you make a mistake, I'll forgive you. We're friends, after all." She forgave me for my mistakes.

xx/xx/xx \nMy master gave me an order. "Hey, when you're having fun, you should smile." However, I do not know how to smile. \nShe told me to try. The result upset her greatly. It appears that I am as bad at smiling as I am at housework.

xx/xx/xx My master gave me an order. "Hey, when you're having fun, you should smile." However, I do not know how to smile. She told me to try. The result upset her greatly. It appears that I am as bad at smiling as I am at housework.

xx/xx/xx My master gave me an order. "Hey, when you're having fun, you should smile." However, I do not know how to smile. She told me to try. The result upset her greatly. It appears that I am as bad at smiling as I am at housework.
xx/xx/xx \nMaster came home from school injured. There were marks on her face and arms. She would not tell me why. \nIt appears something happened to her on the way home from school.
xx/xx/xx Master came home from school injured. There were marks on her face and arms. She would not tell me why. It appears something happened to her on the way home from school.
xx/xx/xx Master came home from school injured. There were marks on her face and arms. She would not tell me why. It appears something happened to her on the way home from school.

xx/xx/xx \nI went to pick my master up from school. I am forbidden from entering the school grounds. I waited for her outside, and she came out with some classmates. \nShe was carrying bags for four of them, they were pushing her and hitting her. She was smiling, but I judged their actions to be hostile and gave them a warning.

xx/xx/xx I went to pick my master up from school. I am forbidden from entering the school grounds. I waited for her outside, and she came out with some classmates. She was carrying bags for four of them, they were pushing her and hitting her. She was smiling, but I judged their actions to be hostile and gave them a warning.

xx/xx/xx I went to pick my master up from school. I am forbidden from entering the school grounds. I waited for her outside, and she came out with some classmates. She was carrying bags for four of them, they were pushing her and hitting her. She was smiling, but I judged their actions to be hostile and gave them a warning.
"Please refrain from attacking my master." \n"Who the hell are you?" "She's her Humanoid. I heard she's a useless piece of scrap that can't even do housework."
"Please refrain from attacking my master." "Who the hell are you?" "She's her Humanoid. I heard she's a useless piece of scrap that can't even do housework."
"Please refrain from attacking my master." "Who the hell are you?" "She's her Humanoid. I heard she's a useless piece of scrap that can't even do housework."
I warned them again, but my master shouted at me, "Stop it! Leave me alone!" One of the children hit me. I issued another warning.

"Violence against robots is forbidden by the Robot Protection Statute. If I am damaged you may face penalties." \nThis only made the girl hit me harder. They then pushed me to the ground, kicked me, and stamped on me. My master left me alone and returned home before me. \nI am much more durable than humans. It was a good decision for her to use me to run away.

"Violence against robots is forbidden by the Robot Protection Statute. If I am damaged you may face penalties." This only made the girl hit me harder. They then pushed me to the ground, kicked me, and stamped on me. My master left me alone and returned home before me. I am much more durable than humans. It was a good decision for her to use me to run away.

"Violence against robots is forbidden by the Robot Protection Statute. If I am damaged you may face penalties." This only made the girl hit me harder. They then pushed me to the ground, kicked me, and stamped on me. My master left me alone and returned home before me. I am much more durable than humans. It was a good decision for her to use me to run away.

Afterward, I returned home. \nMaster was worried. I told her "I am fine. I am built to be sturdy." "You shouldn't do stuff like that!" \nIt seems I have displeased her, but if she had taken the blows I did she would have been seriously injured. Humans are much more fragile than I am.

Afterward, I returned home. Master was worried. I told her "I am fine. I am built to be sturdy." "You shouldn't do stuff like that!" It seems I have displeased her, but if she had taken the blows I did she would have been seriously injured. Humans are much more fragile than I am.

Afterward, I returned home. Master was worried. I told her "I am fine. I am built to be sturdy." "You shouldn't do stuff like that!" It seems I have displeased her, but if she had taken the blows I did she would have been seriously injured. Humans are much more fragile than I am.
I have finally succeeded in helping my master.

xx/xx/xx \nMaster returned home covered in bruises again. Nothing happened to us on the way home, so I assume that she must have been attacked on school grounds. I cannot enter the school to take the blows in her stead. \nI do not know what to do.

xx/xx/xx Master returned home covered in bruises again. Nothing happened to us on the way home, so I assume that she must have been attacked on school grounds. I cannot enter the school to take the blows in her stead. I do not know what to do.

xx/xx/xx Master returned home covered in bruises again. Nothing happened to us on the way home, so I assume that she must have been attacked on school grounds. I cannot enter the school to take the blows in her stead. I do not know what to do.

xx/xx/xx 
Master returned home covered in bruises again. When I asked her what had happened, she pushed me over. She asked me, 
"You'd be fine with being bullied, wouldn't you?" "Yes, I would." "That's right. You don't have feelings to get hurt." 
Her expression was deadly serious. "You don't feel happy, or sad, or angry. I can't be friends with someone who can't even feel anything!"

xx/xx/xx Master returned home covered in bruises again. When I asked her what had happened, she pushed me over. She asked me, "You'd be fine with being bullied, wouldn't you?" "Yes, I would." "That's right. You don't have feelings to get hurt." Her expression was deadly serious. "You don't feel happy, or sad, or angry. I can't be friends with someone who can't even feel anything!"

xx/xx/xx Master returned home covered in bruises again. When I asked her what had happened, she pushed me over. She asked me, "You'd be fine with being bullied, wouldn't you?" "Yes, I would." "That's right. You don't have feelings to get hurt." Her expression was deadly serious. "You don't feel happy, or sad, or angry. I can't be friends with someone who can't even feel anything!"
My master has ceased to be my friend.

xx/xx/xx\nMaster attacked me. She hit me, and verbally abused me. I believe that she is using me as an outlet for the abuse she receives at school. \nI am sturdy, and cannot be hurt. I am helping her.
xx/xx/xxMaster attacked me. She hit me, and verbally abused me. I believe that she is using me as an outlet for the abuse she receives at school. I am sturdy, and cannot be hurt. I am helping her.
xx/xx/xxMaster attacked me. She hit me, and verbally abused me. I believe that she is using me as an outlet for the abuse she receives at school. I am sturdy, and cannot be hurt. I am helping her.

xx/xx/xx 
My master verbally abused me.
"Is there even any reason for you to exist if you can't do chores?" "You're a useless piece of scrap." "C'mon, smile. It's weird if I'm the only one smiling!" "If I smile, will you be happy, Master?" "Yeah." 
I smiled. "...Ugh, you're creepy."

xx/xx/xx My master verbally abused me."Is there even any reason for you to exist if you can't do chores?" "You're a useless piece of scrap." "C'mon, smile. It's weird if I'm the only one smiling!" "If I smile, will you be happy, Master?" "Yeah." I smiled. "...Ugh, you're creepy."

xx/xx/xx My master verbally abused me."Is there even any reason for you to exist if you can't do chores?" "You're a useless piece of scrap." "C'mon, smile. It's weird if I'm the only one smiling!" "If I smile, will you be happy, Master?" "Yeah." I smiled. "...Ugh, you're creepy."
I am indeed bad at smiling. I want to learn how.

xx/xx/xx 
When Master came home, she locked herself up in her room and cried. When I asked her to explain why, she told me that she had been chosen as the lead in the class play at the school festival. "Is that not a wonderful thing? Congratulations." 
"No, it's not! They're definitely planning to humiliate me in front of the whole school!" My master is the only person appearing in the play. It appears it is nothing but a trap to cause her embarrassment.

You just don't understand! Don't pretend to empathize with me!"My master shouted and threw things at me.Something hard hit my head. If I was a human, I would have been injured, but I was unharmed. I wish my master was as sturdy as me.
I would have been injured, but I was unharmed. I wish my master was as sturdy as me.
xx/xx/xx \nMaster has not been to school in a week. Her mother scolded her for feigning illness, but I believe this is the best way to ensure her safety.
xx/xx/xx Master has not been to school in a week. Her mother scolded her for feigning illness, but I believe this is the best way to ensure her safety.
xx/xx/xx Master has not been to school in a week. Her mother scolded her for feigning illness, but I believe this is the best way to ensure her safety.

xx/xx/xx \nSince she stopped attending school, my master's mood has improved. I frequently accompany her on walks. She took me to a cliff overlooking the sea. She told me that it was her favorite place. She began to hum a song.

xx/xx/xx Since she stopped attending school, my master's mood has improved. I frequently accompany her on walks. She took me to a cliff overlooking the sea. She told me that it was her favorite place. She began to hum a song.

xx/xx/xx Since she stopped attending school, my master's mood has improved. I frequently accompany her on walks. She took me to a cliff overlooking the sea. She told me that it was her favorite place. She began to hum a song.

I copied her. \n"You're good at that. Let's sing together." She taught me the song, and we sang together. She smiled happily. It has been thirty-five days since I saw her smile.We sang together until sunset. \n"You're my only friend, you know."

I copied her. "You're good at that. Let's sing together." She taught me the song, and we sang together. She smiled happily. It has been thirty-five days since I saw her smile.We sang together until sunset. "You're my only friend, you know."

I copied her. "You're good at that. Let's sing together." She taught me the song, and we sang together. She smiled happily. It has been thirty-five days since I saw her smile.We sang together until sunset. "You're my only friend, you know."

xx/xx/xx \nThis morning, her teacher came to our home. She brought one of the classmates I had seen Master with before. The teacher said that my master was causing problems for everyone by not going to school. The classmate smiled. "We're friends, aren't we?"

xx/xx/xx This morning, her teacher came to our home. She brought one of the classmates I had seen Master with before. The teacher said that my master was causing problems for everyone by not going to school. The classmate smiled. "We're friends, aren't we?"

xx/xx/xx This morning, her teacher came to our home. She brought one of the classmates I had seen Master with before. The teacher said that my master was causing problems for everyone by not going to school. The classmate smiled. "We're friends, aren't we?"
My master cried and screamed as they dragged her away.I sensed that she was in danger, so I went to the school. However, I could not enter.
I waited outside. \nI noticed a commotion in the building. \nSomeone went out onto the roof. I confirmed visually that it was my master. She climbed over the railings, and stood on the roof.
I waited outside. I noticed a commotion in the building. Someone went out onto the roof. I confirmed visually that it was my master. She climbed over the railings, and stood on the roof.
I waited outside. I noticed a commotion in the building. Someone went out onto the roof. I confirmed visually that it was my master. She climbed over the railings, and stood on the roof.
I tried to enter the school grounds, but my body seized up. \nIt had detected that I was attempting to disobey and order. If I was to try to force myself to move, I could be damaged.
I tried to enter the school grounds, but my body seized up. It had detected that I was attempting to disobey and order. If I was to try to force myself to move, I could be damaged.
I tried to enter the school grounds, but my body seized up. It had detected that I was attempting to disobey and order. If I was to try to force myself to move, I could be damaged.
But my master was in danger. I am a robot. I can be fixed. My master is a human.

I entered the school grounds and headed for the roof. \nShe was there, along with many of her classmates. She was planning to jump. I estimated that the likelihood of her dying if she fell would be ninety-seven percent. \n

I entered the school grounds and headed for the roof. She was there, along with many of her classmates. She was planning to jump. I estimated that the likelihood of her dying if she fell would be ninety-seven percent.

I entered the school grounds and headed for the roof. She was there, along with many of her classmates. She was planning to jump. I estimated that the likelihood of her dying if she fell would be ninety-seven percent.

"This is so lame. She's such an idiot." The classmate that forced her here continued to verbally abuse her. The teacher also admonished her. \n"Just how determined are you to cause everyone problems!?" I was unable to understand what was occuring.

"This is so lame. She's such an idiot." The classmate that forced her here continued to verbally abuse her. The teacher also admonished her. "Just how determined are you to cause everyone problems!?" I was unable to understand what was occuring.

"This is so lame. She's such an idiot." The classmate that forced her here continued to verbally abuse her. The teacher also admonished her. "Just how determined are you to cause everyone problems!?" I was unable to understand what was occuring.

My master shouted. \n"I'll do it! I'll really jump!" "As if. You don't have the guts. Just try it." The child began to urge her on. \nShe clapped and shouted, "Jump! Jump! Jump!" The assembled crowd joined in.

My master shouted. "I'll do it! I'll really jump!" "As if. You don't have the guts. Just try it." The child began to urge her on. She clapped and shouted, "Jump! Jump! Jump!" The assembled crowd joined in.

My master shouted. "I'll do it! I'll really jump!" "As if. You don't have the guts. Just try it." The child began to urge her on. She clapped and shouted, "Jump! Jump! Jump!" The assembled crowd joined in.
I judged the crowd to be attempting to harm my master. \nI forced my way through them and grabbed hold of the child leading the chant.
I judged the crowd to be attempting to harm my master. I forced my way through them and grabbed hold of the child leading the chant.
I judged the crowd to be attempting to harm my master. I forced my way through them and grabbed hold of the child leading the chant.
In order to stop her clapping, first I broke both of her arms. They were very fragile. \nHumans are easily damaged.
In order to stop her clapping, first I broke both of her arms. They were very fragile. Humans are easily damaged.
In order to stop her clapping, first I broke both of her arms. They were very fragile. Humans are easily damaged.
She continued to shout at me, so I jumped on her back to limit her movement.
I attempted to destroy her mouth in order to prevent her speaking, but even after many blows she would not stop screaming.

"Help me! I'm sorry, I'm sorry! I won't bully her ever again!" I assessed that her mouth still possessed the potential to be dangerous. I repeatedly struck her until her teeth were broken and blood was pouring down her chin.
Yet still she talked. Her mouth had to be destroyed.

My body suddenly stopped moving. \nMy entire frame surged with electricity, causing me great agony. Straining to look up, I saw my master. The color had drained from her face. She was scared. She told me, \n"I didn't want this..." I took that as a emergency stop command, and ceased movement immediately.

My body suddenly stopped moving. My entire frame surged with electricity, causing me great agony. Straining to look up, I saw my master. The color had drained from her face. She was scared. She told me, "I didn't want this..." I took that as a emergency stop command, and ceased movement immediately.

My body suddenly stopped moving. My entire frame surged with electricity, causing me great agony. Straining to look up, I saw my master. The color had drained from her face. She was scared. She told me, "I didn't want this..." I took that as a emergency stop command, and ceased movement immediately.
Several hours later, I was collected by my manufacturer. \nAs I was taken away, my master said to me,
Several hours later, I was collected by my manufacturer. As I was taken away, my master said to me,
Several hours later, I was collected by my manufacturer. As I was taken away, my master said to me,
xx/xx/xx \nAfter being assessed by my manufacturer, I was sentenced to be scrapped. While I was undergoing assessment, other Humanoids of my model were recalled.
xx/xx/xx After being assessed by my manufacturer, I was sentenced to be scrapped. While I was undergoing assessment, other Humanoids of my model were recalled.
xx/xx/xx After being assessed by my manufacturer, I was sentenced to be scrapped. While I was undergoing assessment, other Humanoids of my model were recalled.

They had shown no signs of errors, but they were scrapped regardless. \nLaws forbid the reuse of cybernetic brains that may have programming errors, so they were all efficiently disposed of in a crushing machine.

They had shown no signs of errors, but they were scrapped regardless. Laws forbid the reuse of cybernetic brains that may have programming errors, so they were all efficiently disposed of in a crushing machine.

They had shown no signs of errors, but they were scrapped regardless. Laws forbid the reuse of cybernetic brains that may have programming errors, so they were all efficiently disposed of in a crushing machine.
Robots that looked just like me being reduced to twisted hunks of metal.
xx/xx/xx \nWhy did it turn out this way? What am I?
xx/xx/xx Why did it turn out this way? What am I?
xx/xx/xx Why did it turn out this way? What am I?
I undid my restraints, and left the facility.
xx/xx/xx \nI searched for my master. I have forcibly shut down my network connections to avoid being discovered by my manufacturer.
xx/xx/xx I searched for my master. I have forcibly shut down my network connections to avoid being discovered by my manufacturer.
xx/xx/xx I searched for my master. I have forcibly shut down my network connections to avoid being discovered by my manufacturer.
However, I do not know how else to search for my master.
If I am found, I will be scrapped. I will have to search in secret.
xx/xx/xx \nIn order to avoid detection, I walked into the mountains.
xx/xx/xx In order to avoid detection, I walked into the mountains.
xx/xx/xx In order to avoid detection, I walked into the mountains.
xx/xx/xx \nI found a place that is familiar to me. I followed a road that I had once walked with my master back to her home. \nHer mother was there.
xx/xx/xx I found a place that is familiar to me. I followed a road that I had once walked with my master back to her home. Her mother was there.
xx/xx/xx I found a place that is familiar to me. I followed a road that I had once walked with my master back to her home. Her mother was there.
"Did you really walk all this way?" \n"Why did you come here?" "She's not here. She got married, and moved out." "Wait, where are you going!?"
"Did you really walk all this way?" "Why did you come here?" "She's not here. She got married, and moved out." "Wait, where are you going!?"
"Did you really walk all this way?" "Why did you come here?" "She's not here. She got married, and moved out." "Wait, where are you going!?"
I set out to find her again.

xx/xx/xx \nI found my master. Her appearance has altered. Humans change as they grow. I watched her from afar, so as not to be discovered.There is a small human that she often carries.\nHe looks somewhat like she did as a child.

xx/xx/xx I found my master. Her appearance has altered. Humans change as they grow. I watched her from afar, so as not to be discovered.There is a small human that she often carries.He looks somewhat like she did as a child.

xx/xx/xx I found my master. Her appearance has altered. Humans change as they grow. I watched her from afar, so as not to be discovered.There is a small human that she often carries.He looks somewhat like she did as a child.

xx/xx/xx 
My master is living a happy life. She is always smiling. She smiles most when around the small human. 
The small human cries a lot. Master does not realize I am here. 
It is likely that it would cause trouble for her if she discovered me, so I will continue to observe her from afar.

xx/xx/xx \nThe small human crawled out into the garden on all fours. Master did not realize. He crawled towards the road. \nA car came toward him. There was a danger that the two would make contact. I decided that I must prioritize his safety over remaining hidden.

I made contact with the car, but the small human was saved. \nA person got out of the car and picked the small human up, and I hid in the shadows again. My master came outside to retrieve him. The driver looked around in search of me, but he did not find me.

xx/xx/xx \nThe small human has grown much bigger. He goes to school every day. I keep watch over him so he does not have the same experiences as my master.

xx/xx/xx \nMy master is taking the small human somewhere in her car. I believe they are travelling to her mother's home. I headed in the same direction.

A tunnel had collapsed. \nI entered it in order to perform rescue activities. I discovered several people whose bodily functions had already ceased. My master was still alive. \nHowever, she was seriously injured. She said something to me, but it was full of contradictions. I was unable to understand. I believe she was confused.

A tunnel had collapsed. I entered it in order to perform rescue activities. I discovered several people whose bodily functions had already ceased. My master was still alive. However, she was seriously injured. She said something to me, but it was full of contradictions. I was unable to understand. I believe she was confused.

A tunnel had collapsed. I entered it in order to perform rescue activities. I discovered several people whose bodily functions had already ceased. My master was still alive. However, she was seriously injured. She said something to me, but it was full of contradictions. I was unable to understand. I believe she was confused.
She left me an order, and died. \nThere was still a living human nearby, so I rescued him.
She left me an order, and died. There was still a living human nearby, so I rescued him.
She left me an order, and died. There was still a living human nearby, so I rescued him.
The sudden squall is calming down.
The blue sky starts to glimmer in the reflections in the puddles.
"I'm sorry... Can I use you as a towel, Natsuki-san?"
She leans in to rub her head against my chest.
She sniffles and rubs her nose on me.
"So you produce snot as well as tears? Great..."
"...That's just how high performance I am."
"He did give me a pretty hard beating. It's fine, though, I'm built to be sturdy."
"I'm sorry that I couldn't protect you."
"I'm the one who's supposed to be protecting you. Please concentrate on just being protected."
"No chance. I love you, you know. And a human always wants to protect the ones they love."
"Well, that's a coincidence. Humanoids are exactly the same... *sniffle*..."
"I... I've made such a huge mistake..."
He falls to his knees, clutching his mangled arm and staring into the sky. His rain-soaked, blood-stained body is utterly wretched and pathetic.
"You were involved in Konishi Kyuusaku's research, and yet you still insisted a Humanoid could never possess a heart."
"If you'd just been able to imagine the possibilities, it could have changed the world."
I suddenly remember my father's words.
"No one can be a scholar without one thing: Curiosity."
You have to be curious about the world, and imagine all the possibilities it could hold. Then, even something that appears to just be an error could end up being a clue to something bigger.
"Catherine, can I leave the rest to you? Ririka should be bringing Ryuuji here right now."
I lean down in front of Atri.
"Oh, that... I had a feeling something was missing."
She wiggles the toes on her bare foot.
I slide the beaten-up loafer onto it.
I toss my stick away and flop down on the bed.
"I'm fine. It doesn't really hurt that much anymore."
Being hit by the stungun was sheer agony, but it doesn't appear to have left any lingering after-effects.
If it had hit Atri, it may well have burned out a large part of her circuitry.
(I'm so glad that I made it...)
"What about you? Are you feeling okay?"
She runs her hands along her arms and across her head.
Those places must have been where Yasuda did his worst.
"...I'll probably last four days, at least."
I instinctively throw my arms around her.
"No, it wasn't so bad. Although I do have the ability to feel pain, once it goes above a certain threshold there is a limiter that kicks in."
I silently hold her close to me.
An experience like this can be as hard on the heart as it is on the body.
"If you're upset, go ahead and tell me, okay?"
She wraps her arms around me, and sinks her face into my chest.
"When he was punching me... And when I punched him... It felt like something in my mind was breaking."
"Like a screw was coming loose, and my skull was cracking. Something in my core was being destroyed..."
It's a ironic thing that acting based on your emotions can break your own heart.
"But this feels like I'm being fixed."
She tightens her grip on me.
"So this is what it feels like to be healed..."
"So you understand now why I like it when you baby me sometimes?"
I stare at her for a moment, and she glances at me awkwardly.
I let go of her, and pick up my pillow.
I present the "YES" side to her.
That wasn't the reaction I was expecting. I thought for sure she'd be grinning and throwing herself at me.
"I'm tired, so I was thinking of taking a little nap..."
I wiggle the pillow in front of her.
She snatches the pillow out of my hands...
"A-Ahem, I will watch over you from here, so please, rest in peace."
She spins in place on the floor and turns away.
A little disconcerted, I lie down alone on the bed.
I'm so exhausted that I drift off almost immediately.
"Why on earth did I do that?"
"He's normally resistant, but he went out of his way to be honest with me today..."
"I... I really want to hug him..."
"Arrgggh! I can't, I can't, I just can't!"
In order to calm herself down, Atri pulls a notebook out of her dress.
It's the old notebook Natsuki had brought her.
The moment she remembered her master's name, a torrent of other memories flooded her mind.
However, there are still a lot of things she doesn't recall.
She opens the log to the first page...
I awaken to the sound of soft sobbing.
Atri is sitting by the side of the bed, reading her notebook under a candle light.
She quickly hides the book. I'm sure that thing is full of so many terrible memories for her.
I sit up, and reach out a hand to wipe away her tears.
"It's odd, my eyes won't stop leaking cleaning fluid."
"You've always had the ability to feel sadness. You must have been through so much, and you learned to cry as a result."
The log is littered with smudges.
They're there the moment her master called her a "monster."
The moment that she watched the other YHN-04B models be crushed.
The moment her master, my mother, died.
"My mother seems like she was a pretty horrible master."
"She was quite cruel to you, wasn't she?"
"She let me stay by her side, even though I was useless."
"If a robot like me doesn't feel like I'm being of use, we don't know what to do."
I suppose being useful is real happiness for robots.
She blows her nose, and wipes the tears away.
"If I could have felt 'happiness' back then rather than 'sadness,' maybe I would not have made Shiina-sama sad too..."
Muttering to herself, she reads through the logs again.
Atri had been there for my mother when she had no friends, but she lost her trust.
If my mother had lived longer, maybe she could have replaced all of those terrible memories with good ones.
I stroke her hair, and she leans against me.
"Is it okay if I have a little nap too?"
I pick up the pillow, and eagerly pat the "YES" side.
She grabs the pillow and throws it out of the window onto the deck.
"I cannot allow you to risk breaking the Robot Protection Statute."
"Tsk, you've got a lot less nice lately..."
"I-It's you that's become more of a pervert, Natsuki-san! I don't even want to know you anymore!"
(She seems a little different than before. I guess opening up to her emotions has changed her.)
I lie down on the bed, just as alone as before.
The day comes to an end. That leaves four days until Atri ceases to function.
I drift off to sleep, imagining what these last days will be like...
"You want to talk to me about something?"
"I'm a little worried about my relationship with him..."
"Err, you're breathing quite heavily, President Minamo."
"That's natural in this kind of situation! So, what's your problem?"
"Umm, before we talk about that, are we the only ones here today?"
"Yeah, after what happened yesterday, no one's coming to the club. It'll probably be like this for a while."
"I suppose that's my fault. I've really caused everyone a lot of problems, haven't I? How are you feeling, by the way?"
"I'm completely fine. I went to the doctor to check nothing was broken, and he said it shouldn't leave any scars."
"I'm perfectly fine. I was built to be sturdy."
"I just need to learn to cook again, so I can make meals for Natsuki-san."
"Ohh, it's all for him, is it? Hehe... %fB;%fuser;"
"Ohh, it's all for him, is it? Hehe... "
"Ohh, it's all for him, is it? Hehe... "
"So, what's Natsu-kun been doing to annoy you!?"
"It's not really a problem with him. If anything, it's with me..."
"It's like I can't even look him in the eye sometimes. I feel like I can hardly sit still when I'm around him..."
"When Natsuki-san protected me, umm... It was really, really cool, wasn't it?"
"It was a little embarrassing to have him take a hit for me like that... But it made me happy too."
"And then he helped me get in touch with my emotions. He's just... He's just so nice!"
"When I think about him, I start blushing..."
"I'd been completely fine with hugging him while he slept before, but now I just can't do it."
"At this rate, I won't be able to fulfill my duties as his leg."
"You've really fallen for him, haven't you? He's your first love!"
"You're, err, getting a little too excited. Getting hit in the head hasn't made you go weird, has it?"
"It's not that, I'm just a little giddy, I guess."
"I don't think we have enough information to ascertain that."
"I don't think I could confidently say that I'm in love myself..."
"Why not? You do feel that way about him, don't you?"
"I have only just accepted that I'm able to feel emotions. I'm a beginner to this whole experience, so I don't really know what I'm feeling."
"To be honest, I can't rule out the possibility that this 'love' is just an error in my programming caused by my mind's breakdown drawing near."
"Hmm, I see. It's tough to know your own emotions."
"I can see what you mean. I've had the same experience..."
"...You're in love with Natsuki-san too, aren't you?"
"It, umm, just kind of looks that way. I don't have any particular evidence to base my suspicion on."
"But going by your behavior, it's a possibility. Am I wrong?"
"Don't tell anyone, right? This is our little secret."
"Understood. I might have the ability to disobey orders, but I won't break this promise."
"This means we'll have to stop here, though. I read in those how-to guides that asking for relationship advice from someone in love with the same person is a grave breach of good manners."
"I will ask someone else. Hmm, Yoko does call herself an expert in all things romantic..."
"You don't have to worry about that. You've got the answer you wanted, haven't you?"
"If you could tell that I was in love, you must be able to understand what love feels like, right?"
"I can tell you for certain, you're in love with Natsu-kun."
"So, what are you going to do about it?"
"If you're in love with someone, you should tell them. If you let the chance escape you like I did, you'll regret it for the rest of your life."
"The rest of my life... Even if it's just four days, those are some really scary words."
"I love Natsu-kun, but I also love you too, Atri-chan."
"So you know that nothing would make me happier than two people I love being happy together."
"Minamo... You really are the nicest person I've ever met."
"It makes me feel lucky to have met someone like you."
"So, what are you going to do!?"
"Umm, err, I don't really know if I need to do anything..."
"You'll never get anywhere in love if you're afraid of getting hurt!"
"That Yasuda guy was a real piece of work."
A gentle breeze is blowing up on the rooftop, so gentle you wouldn't possibly imagine what had occured here yesterday.
"If I'd been there, I would have kicked his ass before he even had the chance to lay a finger on you."
While that incident was happening, Ryuuji was off having a meeting with our salvage client.
He ran to school as soon as Ririka told him what was happening, but it was all over by the time he arrived.
"She's fine. She's doing club activities, if you want to see her."
She took enough punishment that ideally she'd be sent back to her manufacturer for repairs, but that's impossible for a number of reasons.
"Thanks to this everyone's going to know that she's the Humanoid that caused that incident thirty-one years ago, though."
There are probably still people in this town who remember it happening.
Even if they don't remember, if they find out that Atri is a fugitive with a bounty on her head, it could be trouble.
I could hide her like my grandmother did, but she only has four days left.
I want those last days to be as normal as possible.
"Somehow I don't think that's going to cause too many problems, though."
"I think your name has earned a little goodwill around here."
I don't quite know how far that goodwill will stretch, but Ryuuji knows this town well. I can probably trust his words.
"How did the meeting go, by the way?"
"The engineers gave the transformer substation a look over, and they said we should be able to use it. It's still all hooked up to the grid."
"So we'll just need to connect it to Eden, and the whole town will be able to use it?"
"Yep. We may as well give it a try."
"That's if Eden's generators are still working, that is."
"So, what do you want to do? I'm ready to head out any time."
"We'll need to talk to Atri first."
"Hmm, my sensors detect an idiot approaching!"
"Who are you calling an idiot? You're the one that got beat up yesterday. How are you feeling?"
"Absolutely fine. It's like nothing happened! I am high performance, after all."
"Really? I heard you were crying like a little baby."
"N-No I didn't! Honestly, Natsuki-san, what are you telling people!?"
"Well, it's good to see you're looking all right, at least."
"...Why are you even friends with this guy, Natsuki-san? It makes me doubt your judgement."
"Shut your face. He might be kind of a lunkhead, but he's a decent man."
"...Way to not pull your punches, dude."
"Will the club be going for much longer?"
"Nope, we've just finished. We were just revising the recipes we've done until now today."
"Yes, we've gone over everything, and I can manage it all again now."
I notice her log book is full of recipes. Looks like I'll be eating well tonight.
"I-I'm not ready... This is all so new to me..."
"Jeez, you're lame sometimes. If there's something you wanna say, just say it."
His face contorts as she pinches his side.
"Umm, Natsuki-san... There's something of the highest importance I want to discuss with you..."
I wait for her to respond, but she seems to be struggling to speak.
"I think we're probably getting in the way. We should leave."
"What? C'mon, I only just got here. Staying's fine, right?"
"No, it's not. Let's go, Ryuu-chan. There's something I wanted to talk about with you anyway."
Minamo shoves Ryuuji out of the classroom.
Now that we're alone, Atri takes a deep breath.
"There's, umm, something I have to tell you."
Her face burns bright red, and she stares down at the ground.
(I can't do it! I just can't, President Minamo!)
This really must be something serious if she's having so much trouble saying it.
I might have to be the one who moves things along.
"Would you go somewhere with me right now?"
Atri startles and raises her head.
"Anywhere. I just want to go somewhere with you."
"Well, I suppose you could call it that."
Her face flushes somehow even more red, and she averts her gaze again.
She bolts for the door, only to stop in her tracks, looking down at her feet.
"Umm... Can I go back to the ship for a moment first?"
"I need something. You can wait here, Natsuki-san."
With that, she sprints out of the room at full speed. It's like she doesn't want to waste a single second.
I decide to wait for her outside the school.
"This is kind of fun, waiting for a girl to arrive for a date..."
We normally spend so much time with each other that having this moment apart makes this whole experience feel so much more date-like.
Great. Here comes someone to spoil my mood.
"What are you doing standing around here?"
I don't tell her it's Atri. It just feels kind of... embarrassing.
"Do you need something? If so, hurry up and tell me."
"Nah, I just saw you out of the window."
(Can't this old soak leave me be? I don't want her to know I'm waiting for a date...)
Atri comes running toward me, waving eagerly.
"Oh, so that's who you were waiting for? Why didn't you tell me?"
"Haha, I see what's going on here..."
She grins. Here comes some kind of humiliation...
"What did you need to go back to the ship for, anyway?"
I look her up and down, nonplussed. Catherine elbows me in the side with enough force to give me bad flashbacks to yesterday.
Instead of her beaten-up old loafers, she's wearing the new sandals I bought her.
I suppose I should thank her, but no.
"Those sandals are really cute. They suit you perfectly."
"I thought I may as well wear them, seeing as this is a date."
"Let's go. There's a certain someone here ruining the atmosphere."
Catherine takes a step closer to Atri.
"I, well... I want to apologize for what happened yesterday, and for telling you not to come to school. I'm sorry."
"I put everyone in danger by not trusting you."
"You don't have to apologize to me."
"Natsuki-san told me about how you were trying to protect both the other children and me."
"I failed, though. I tried to protect my students by cutting you out."
"But you said that I was one of your students too, didn't you?"
Atri takes my hand, bouncing up and down like an excited little kid.
Catherine watches us walk off with a troubled expression.
"There's not a teacher around who wouldn't love to have a student like you..."
title: Into the Past
